DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the immunoglobulin chain number involved.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Glycoproteins present in the blood (ANTIBODIES) and in other tissue. They are classified by structure and activity into five classes (IMMUNOGLOBULIN A; IMMUNOGLOBULIN D; IMMUNOGLOBULIN E; IMMUNOGLOBULIN G; IMMUNOGLOBULIN M)._A series of objects linked, connected, or associated together in linear fashion, e.g. the assemblage of atoms, radicals and chemical groups in a chemical compound, or an assemblage of individual microorganisms. Also, a group of enterprises or institutions of the same kind similar function, usually under a single ownership, management, or control._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Glycoproteins present in the blood (ANTIBODIES) and in other tissue. They are classified by structure and activity into five classes (IMMUNOGLOBULIN A; IMMUNOGLOBULIN D; IMMUNOGLOBULIN E; IMMUNOGLOBULIN G; IMMUNOGLOBULIN M).:A series of objects linked, connected, or associated together in linear fashion, e.g. the assemblage of atoms, radicals and chemical groups in a chemical compound, or an assemblage of individual microorganisms. Also, a group of enterprises or institutions of the same kind similar function, usually under a single ownership, management, or control.

Concepts.definition: Any of the structurally related glycoproteins that function as antibodies. They are divided into five classes (IGA, IGD, IGE, IGG, IGM) on the basis of structure and biological activity.

A series of objects linked, connected, or associated together in linear fashion (e.g., the assemblage of atoms, radicals and chemical groups in a chemical compound, or an assemblage of individual microorganisms).

Property.preferredDefinition: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Glycoproteins present in the blood (ANTIBODIES) and in other tissue. They are classified by structure and activity into five classes (IMMUNOGLOBULIN A; IMMUNOGLOBULIN D; IMMUNOGLOBULIN E; IMMUNOGLOBULIN G; IMMUNOGLOBULIN M)._A series of objects linked, connected, or associated together in linear fashion, e.g. the assemblage of atoms, radicals and chemical groups in a chemical compound, or an assemblage of individual microorganisms. Also, a group of enterprises or institutions of the same kind similar function, usually under a single ownership, management, or control._An occurrence of something._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of the structurally related glycoproteins that function as antibodies.
